title: Re-apply for a driving licence following a medical condition

details.description: Re-apply for a driving licence if your licence was taken away (revoked) or if you surrendered your licence following a medical condition
details.body:
If your licence was taken away or surrendered for health reasons, you must re-apply to DVLA before you start driving again.

Check with your doctor that you can meet the medical standards of fitness to drive before re-applying for your licence.

DVLA will send you a letter when your licence is taken away or surrendered, or if your application for a driving licence is refused. This tells you if there’s a period of time you need to wait before getting a new licence.

You can then re-apply 8 weeks before the end of this period. The letter will also tell you if you need to send any evidence of your fitness to drive with your application.

Car or motorcycle licence

Fill in a D1 application form and the right questionnaire for your medical condition, and send them to DVLA.

Search for your medical condition to find the right questionnaire.

Order a D1 pack, which has everything you need to make an application.

D1 packs are also available from Post Office branches.

Bus, coach or lorry licence

Fill in a D2 application form and the right questionnaire for your medical condition, and send them to DVLA.

Search for your medical condition to find the right questionnaire.

Order a D2 pack which has everything you need to make an application.

If you’re aged 45 to 65 you also have to fill in a D4 and send it to DVLA if you haven’t done so in the past 5 years. Send it in with your D2 form.

From the age of 65, your licence will need to be renewed each year and your application must be accompanied by a completed D4 medical report form.

Download ‘D4 Medical examination report’ (PDF, 211KB)

Download ‘D4 information leaflet’ (PDF, 286KB)

Driving licences issued from 14 October 2012 look different, but existing licences are still valid.

Where to send your application

Send your completed application to DVLA by fax on 0845 850 0095 or by post.
